title.narrative: 8.3 MANAGEMENT FOR RESULTS (M4R)

description.narrative: Output 8.3 Programme Planning and Monitoring: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 8: The Nigeria country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.3 Programme Planning and Monitoring: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes

description.narrative: Implemented new procedures for planning and monitoring and changed programme review process to a more result-oriented process. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of workplans fully aligned with CPD, RAM and KRC
Percentage of planned research and studies from IMEP which are completed on time and uploaded in EISI
Percentage of issues identified by the quarterly monitoring reports addressed by subsequent quarter
Percentage of Outputs which are updated within office deadlines in the Results Assessment Module (RAM)
Percentage of donor reports submitted on time
Existence of MICS6 survey at national level

actual.value: 2019:Targets for 2019 included signing of UNICEF-NBS MoU, conducting stakeholder meeting, establishing MICS governance structure at all management levels, recruiting UNICEF MICS Consultant, finalizing data gap assessment. Data collection is planned for June/ July 2020.
